sen.j: 良弘（りょうこう、康治元年（1142年）- 没年未詳）は、平安時代後期の真言宗小野流の僧。
sen.e: Ryoko (born in 1142, the year of death unknown) is a priest of Shingon sect Ono school in the late Heian period.
Ryoko (born in 1142; date of death unknown) was a monk of the Ono school of the Shingon Sect during the late Heian period.

sen.j: 能登国権守藤原孝能の子。
sen.e: He was a son of FUJIWARA no Takayoshi, Noto no kuni Gon no kami (Provisional Governor of Noto Province).
sen.cmt: 「藤原孝能」の正しい読みが不明です。「FUJIWARA no Takayoshi」としました。

sen.j: 醍醐寺に住し、平氏政権下において平清盛の信任を受ける。
sen.e: Ryoko lived in Daigo-ji Temple and enjoyed the confidence of TAIRA no Kiyomori under the Taira clan government.
Ryoko resided in Daigo-ji Temple and enjoyed the trust and confidence of TAIRA no Kiyomori under the Taira Clan Administration.

sen.j: 権少僧都の任にあった治承2年（1178年）には建礼門院徳子の御着帯に際して安産祈願を行う。
sen.e: In 1178, when he was at the rank of gon shosozu (Junior lesser prelate), he prayed for easy delivery for Kenreimonin Tokuko at her Ochakutai (a ceremony of putting on a maternity belt).
In 1178, at the rank of Gon Shosozu (Junior Lesser Prelate), Ryoko prayed for safe birth for the child of Kenreimonin Tokuko at her Ochakutai (a ceremony for the donning of a maternity belt).
sen.cmt: rewording;"Prelate" is a Christian terminology; probably should not be used here.
sen.e: In 1178, at the rank of Gon Shosozu (a provisional junior rank in the second highest managerial position), Ryoko prayed for safe birth for the child of Kenreimonin Tokuko at her Ochakutai (a ceremony for the donning of a maternity belt).
sen.cmt: 権少僧都 用語集の表記に従い(Junior Lesser Prelate) を(a provisional junior rank in the second highest managerial position) に修正しました。

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）の以仁王の挙兵の際には怨敵退散の祈願を行い、その褒賞として権大僧都に進む。
sen.e: On Rising of Prince Mochihito in 1180, Ryoko prayed for expulsion of mortal enemy, and received promotion to gondaisozu.
During the Rising of Prince Mochihito in 1180, Ryoko prayed for defeat of the arch enemy, and was praised and rewarded with a promotion to the rank of Gondaisozu.

sen.j: 徳子の産んだ言仁親王が安徳天皇として即位するとその護持僧に任じられ、さらに平家一門と密接な関係を持つに至った。
sen.e: When Tokuko's son Imperial Prince Tokihito was enthroned as Emperor Antoku, Ryoko was appointed as a gojiso (a priest who prays to guard the emperor), resulting in his closer relationship with the Taira clan.

When Tokuko's son, Imperial Prince Tokihito was enthroned as Emperor Antoku, Ryoko was appointed as a Gojiso (a monk who protects the Emperor through prayer), resulting in his closer relationship with the Taira Clan.

sen.j: このため、寿永2年（1183年）に源義仲に追われて平家一門が都落ちした際には、これと行動をともにして西海に赴く。
sen.e: Therefore, when the Taira clan was exiled from Kyoto by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka in 1183, Ryoko went with them to the Saikai (provinces on the western seacoast).
Therefore, when the Taira Clan was exiled from Kyoto by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka in 1183, Ryoko followed them to the Saikai region (provinces on the Western Seacoast of Japan).

sen.j: さらに二年の後、平家が最終的な敗北を喫した元暦2年（1185年）の壇ノ浦の戦いにおいて、平時忠ら多くの廷臣や僧侶とともに捕虜となる。
sen.e: Two years later, in 1885, when the Taira clan suffered the final defeat at the Battle of Dannoura, Ryoko was among many retainers of Imperial Court, such as TAIRA no Tokitada, and priests to be taken captive.

Two years later, in 1185, when the Taira Clan suffered the final defeat at the Battle of Dannoura, Ryoko was among many monks and retainers of the Imperial Court, such as TAIRA no Tokitada, to be taken captive.

Two years later, in 1185, when the Taira Clan suffered the final defeat at the Battle of Dan no ura, Ryoko was among many priests and retainers of the Imperial Court, such as TAIRA no Tokitada, to be taken captive.

sen.j: その後都へ連行され、審議の上阿波国へ流罪となった。
sen.e: Then he was taken to Kyoto and, after deliberation, banished to Awa Province.
After been taken to Kyoto, where a deliberation for his punishment was held, he was banished to the Awa Province.

sen.j: 文治4年（1188年）に赦免され都に戻ったが、その後の足跡は不明である。
sen.e: Ryoko was pardoned in 1188 and returned to Kyoto, but the rest of his life is unknown.
